inn1.comm: guided off the back foot into the covers. No great movement there for Anderson yet
beauty! A cracker from Anderson swinging this away from Perera at the last moment who came forward, nervously and tentatively, the ball beating his outside edge
and a nervous Perera is off the mark, angling this safely past the two slips down to third man
Sanath's off in a hurry. It was in the slot to be fair and he just swung it over mid-on for four. A clubbing sort of shot, and effective enough
shorter, and on his legs, Sanath scoops this and gets a top edge down to fine-leg which falls just short of Stuart Broad
pushed to mid-on
too wide and rightly wided. Jayasuriya flung his bat at it but missed it by a country mile
punched out to mid-off
outside the off stump, he takes a step down the pitch before deciding to cut it down to third man. Good length from Sidebottom there
poor line on his legs and Perera nudges it through midwicket

inside edge and four! Very close to knocking that onto his stumps. An excellent length from Sidebottom, inducing a drive from Perera but he never moved his feet and the ball evaded Mustard's dive to his left
wide down the leg side
nudged to leg for a single
on middle stump, firmly defended
a good line from Anderson outside the off stump and Perera defends
short of the slips. He came forward tentatively and got a thick outside edge that fell short of slip
punched, not altogether comfortably, past point
excellent line and a testing length from Anderson. Sanath blocks this out with ferocious intent
too short and the wrong line, but Jayasuriya can't time this pull and just picks up a couple
a front-footed slap for six over midwicket! What a shot that is. A march down the wicket, and a dismissive swat for six as though waving away a wasp
cautious, solidly defended
short of a length and Perera waits on the back foot before turning it around the corner for a single. No, in fact they're coming back for two here...and Perera is quick
a huge, angry appeal from the otherwise calm Sidebottom. Sounded like he got bat on that though...and, either way, it pitched outside leg

pushed out on the front foot and Jayasuriya is called through for a single. In comes Collingwood - literally - and the pair collapse into the stumps. Ouch. Sanath has come out of it better than Collingwood
pushed out to cover for an easy single
well, he came forward and hid the bat inside the line. A touch too wide from Sidebottom
very good length from Anderson. He was in two minds, Jayasuriya, before deciding to stay on the back foot where he got an inside edge into his pads
beautifully driven out through extra cover. Calmly punched and they pick up two
on his legs and Jayasuriya sort of swivel-punches this to leg. Rather lucky that he didn't top-edge it in fact
guided out to point by Perera
dropped by the bowler. Smacked back to Anderson who couldn't take it in his follow-through
close! Very close indeed as Jayasuriya tries to pull Anderson but misses. Batsman and bowler grunt in surprise
Perera is beaten outside the off stump, coming forward but failing to connect
that's very well bowled, angling this across the right hander who swings and misses
nudged to leg
a huge shout from Sidebottom - that's massive, and he shows impressive vocal abilities there. Sanath is rapped on the pads but the umpire reckons it's going down leg
defended on the front foot
and calmly punched out to cover to end the over
short of a length, on off stump, Jayasuriya gives it due respect, defending it off the back foot
on the front foot - slap! Slap, bang, wallop from Jayasuriya who hits this flat over midwicket for six
on his legs but it's fuller this time and he whips it to leg for a single. No, for two. No, for three as the throw deflects off the stumps
Perera's firmly behind this, defending it solidly
Perera steps to the off side before whipping it to leg ala Pietersen. Monty fields and, with a big and ultra-eager wind-up, throws down the stumps
got him! Almost identical to the previous match, Sanath beaten by the slower ball and he punches it straight to Pietersen at mid-off
ooh hello, here's another wicket. An excellent and nasty bouncer which he top edges ... but fortunately it falls short of Mustard who was hot-footing it in
cautiously forward, he defends
on middle-and-off, he comes forward to defend and does so in style
flicked straight back to Sidebottom who stops it with his size 10s
good line and an excellent full length which is tentatively defended
cor, ripper mate. Angling across the right hander who is beaten
full, straight and defended
on the walk, it's guided to mid-on. No great power or conviction
pushed to cover
excellent line, attacking his off stump. He comes forward to defend
what a stroke of luck! He tried to turn this to leg and got a leading edge which somehow fell short of mid-off
flicked to leg
skips down the pitch and knocks this over mid-on
carved outside the off stump past the second slip. It would have been a testing catch for third slip, in fact
beautifully carved to point
quite brilliant fielding from Collingwood at backward point. Sangakkara nailed it on the front foot but Collingwood was down on his haunches and made a great save
pushed back to the bowler
inside edged down to third man
too much width and that's slapped through the air past a motionless Collingwood at point
more width, more punishment. That's a bit of a gimme for a nervous debutant. Except, of course, he's no longer nervous after two shots of that calibre
tighter, quicker and angling to the pads. A better line and half an appeal from Anderson, but Sangakkara hustles the debutant through for a quick single
just back of a length, and driven down to mid-off
banged  in shorter again, and whipped firmly to backward square leg
drifting onto the pads and nudged behind square
perfect line and length, pitching on middle and angling towards off from over the wicket. Defended, as you would
a floatier sort of a delivery - looked like a slower ball - but a touch too full. Chipped with a flourish to backward square, and that's good running too
down the track in an attempt to smear a low full-toss, but instead the ball trickles to gully
defended with the sturdiest of vertical bats. Picked up at midwicket
two steps down the track but Sidebottom is equal to the challenge, and drags his delivery down to turn it into the perfect length ball. Cunning play
back onto his stumps this time, and a glided edge to third man keeps the scoreboard ticking round
turned off the hip and fielded at square leg
short, and pulled with great intent but no great power behind square
fuller length and that beats Perera's defensive thrust, but that was going over the top as Broad half-appeals
turned off the hip, and a fumble by Sidebottom at short backward square allows an easy two
misdirected, way down leg
on the pads and worked away fine
five runs off the over, and here's Sidebottom again
perfect. Perfect line, perfect length, perfect half-bat-width's movement. That pitched on middle and kept going across the right hander. Easy catch for Mustard and Sidebottom has the breakthrough
props quietly forward and smothers a good-length ball
defended into the covers

well, well, another duck for Jayawardene, and once again it's a very soft dismissal. Tries to whip across the line, gets a looping leading edge, and Broad slides in from mid-on to scoop the catch inches from the turf!
right on the money again from Sidebottom. Defended into the covers
and another immaculate length delivery completes a double-wicket maiden. Very very well bowled
steered off the back foot, straight to point
fizzes through outside off stump
very nearly a wide, but the umpire shows leniency as Sangakkara opts to shoulder arms
not quite so wide this time but Sangakkara has a go all the same, a thick outside edge squirts down to third man
banged in short of a length, outside off stump, defended with a hop off the back foot
shorter, a genuine bouncer this time, and well directed. Silva ducks to complete another steady over
good length, turned off the back foot and fielded on the leg side
good length, a trace of inswing as well, but solidly defended
good length again, no width to work with
very tidy over so far, again a hint of inswing to keep the batsman honest
that's in the slot for Silva and he takes full toll with a very sweetly timed cover drive. Lovely high elbow and that's the first boundary in five overs
on the pads to finish and turned to backward square
short and slapped square, but just short of Collingwood in the gully. Hands on heads for the England fielders
another short ball, too much width, but Silva slaps it straight to point
outside off stump, but Silva doesn't cash in
frustration mounting for Silva - yet another short, wide delivery, but Cook's interception at point saves another certain boundary
fuller and straighter to the left-hander, and an instant call brings a quick single
another cuttable delivery, but again Silva can't time it. A disappointing over for him
good length on off stump, fielded in the covers
pushed towards the blockhole, Sangakkara is into position for the drive, but can't time it
good ball, pitching middle-and-off and angling away. Sangakkara leaves alone
shorter, and slapped into the covers. No great power though
full length, a fraction off line and whipped wristily to square leg. Can't beat the field
good finish to the over, a yorker that shapes to swing away from the right-hander. Defended with a hint of a leading edge
in the slot for the drive, but Sangakkara elects for a measured punch into the gap between the bowler and mid-off. Pietersen fields with a swoop
outside off and defended
short and struck, hard, but Collingwood at gully pounces like a penalty-saving goalkeeper. More frustration on the cut for Silva
drawn forward and defended into the gap in the covers. Easy single
threaded through gully off the back foot
outside off stump, defended off the back foot. Another tidy over as England begin to exert control over the middle overs
good loop, plenty  air to start with, but a long way outside off. Turned into the leg-side
a ripper! Lots of flight and bite, and Sangakkara was beaten by a big turner from the rough
more flight, a more measured response from Sangakkara who finds another single into the leg-side
lots of flight, Silva turns it into a yorker as he charges down to meet it. Good drift with the arm
slow and steady from Monty, which is good to see for England fans. Lots of potential for big spin
fully forward to smother the last ball of the over
good ball outside off which is punched, nothing more, to cover. No great intent in the stroke
good line but a touch shorter this time, allowing the left hander to dab it backward of point for a single
full, straight and swinging into the right hander who punches it back to Broad
woops. Commentator's curse there. Much too short from Broad and it's dispatched with an angry pull, in front of square, for four
guided out to third man
a slower ball which is punched with textbook style...but unfortunately straight to cover
oh well swept - that's a fantastic shot. A loopy delivery from Monty, on middle stump, but he really got down quickly and swept it well in front of square for four
poor line this time. It's down the leg side and again he sweeps, but without the timing of his previous one
Sangakkara opens the blade and the ball spins back into him, and off him, and they run a single
cracked to Monty's left. The Montster makes a good, athletic stop
outside the off stump, Sangakkara pokes it out to cover for a slick single
too short and easily swept through midwicket
on middle-and-leg, just a touch of turn and it's nudged around the corner
full but wide of the off stump and chipped, or angled, out to point
outside off, pushed out to cover
too short and he whips it to leg for another milky single
too short but Sangakkara, though he thrashed his bat at it, couldn't place it as well he might. It flies down to third man

and he's bowled him! Has he? Sangakkara tried to sweep but it was too full, and he didn't connect either...and the batsman is standing his ground. The umpire has called a wide and here comes the replay...which confirms he is comprehensively bowled. A ripper from Shah - that turned prodigiously. A beautiful ball
too straight and turned to leg
ooh well bowled, well flighted from Monty. It's pushed out to cover, calmly
a calm sweep down to fine leg
short, wide and cut hard into deep extra cover
whacked back to Monty who fumbles in the field
pushed out to cover
nicely flighted outside off. Smothered on the front foot
just a little too full this time and the batsman easily chips it out to cover
too short and wide, paddled around the corner to fine leg. Sidebottom sprints round like a shire horse to field
rubbish. A full toss which he gets away with as the right hander cracks this square, with one hand, out into the deep
a beauty! The arm-ball perhaps - it went straight on, anyway - and he's beaten. Neat take by Mustard
on middle-and-off, it's defended
that's the line and length from Monty. This spears into his middle stump and it's smothered
he goes inside out and works it out to cover
poor. Short, down the leg side, it's swept with ease
tossed up on the off stump. Nicely flighted and it's given due respect by the batsman
a wider ball elegantly flashed to point
solidly defended (not deafened, as I nearly typed)
well bowled! Another arm-ball which beats the batsman. Neat take from Dijon behind the stumps
shorter this time and it's cracked square of the wicket
pushed to leg
outside the off stump, pushing the batsman wider who rocks to leg before cutting this past point. Neat stroke but without great timing or power
too short this time and the batsman all-too-easily nudges him to leg
filthy from Shah! What an ugly ball that is. Straight down the leg side and it's wided
timed past point for a singley single
hit hard to mid-off who makes a good diving save
fuller from Monty this time, cramping the batsman for room who works it out into the off side
he mis-sweeps here. But again, Monty's lost his line
pushed out to cover
nudged into the covers once more - that's well bowled. Almost took the batsman off his feet here
and it's defended out to the off side, once again
a little leg-sideish but nevertheless a good length
more vocals from Dijon behind the stumps as Bopara sends down another straight delivery which is defended
a touch of inswing into the right hander. Nice and full
chopped down to third man
gone! A complete mix-up. Dilshan dropped it out into the off side where Bell was lurking. There was never a run there. Crazy stuff from Dilshan
short and angling into the left hander who pumps it off the back foot
a good start from Broad, as he so often is, on off stump which is defended
swinging back into the batsman who defends
timed out to point
nudged to leg
very good length which is cautiously pushed to Sidebottom at mid-off. And Sidebottom falls a little heavily, and is floored with cramp. On comes the physio to sort him out
short, wide
turned leg-side
on middle-and-leg, and flicked away fine
a bit of width to the right hander, who glides a single down to third man
on that leg-stump line again to the left-hander. Played off the hip
nothing to work with that. On the spot, and slow enough to keep the batsman honest
on the legs again, and Luke Wright makes good ground at fine leg to keep them to one. A hint of a mix-up was beckoning there
short and flashes down the leg-side, Mustard goes up for the appeal, but the umpire is not fooled
banged in short again, but outside off this time
short again, and down the leg-side again. Good aggression but misdirected, and that's called no-ball. The first of the series!
free-hit or no free-hit, that was freely hit! Smashed through the covers. Lovely strike
defended to backward point
better line and length, and Bell comes within a whisker of completing the run-out. His shy from short cover just misses the stumps. That would have been out by a distance
back of a length, good pace and aggression. Mubarak defends with a hop
outside off stump,. stroked elegantly into the covers, but straight to the fielder
good line and length to resume, pushed calmly back up the pitch
drawn forward, defended
finds the gap in the off side
a massive swish and a miss, well taken by Mustard who fails to be off-put by the swinging blade in his eyeline
opens the face and turns to point
opens the face again, steers slightly finer, but can't beat the diving gully
out to midwicket
on leg-stump, clipped square
another scampered single
down on the sweep, finds the gap behind square
flighted delivery on off stump, turned to midwicket
good hang time again from that delivery, pitches in the rough outside off and nudged to gully
in the blockhole and a hint of inswing too, a decent shout from Bopara but that was always missing leg
another good delivery. Full-length, angling in, defended
tries for that blockhole delivery, but off target and clipped sweetly through the gap at midwicket
outside off, nudged away
width outside off stump, swerving away, well taken
on leg and drifting away, turned square
loop and turn, nice areas Monty
down on one knee and swept hard into the deep. Picked up on the fine leg boundary
Mubarak also shapes to sweep, a delicate flick from outside off
floated into the blockhole, and Silva dabs that behind square to complete his half-century. Well batted
a filthy wide long-hop, and Mubarak steers it straight into Bopara's midriff at gully! That is tamer than Paris Hilton's chihuahua, and a very timely wicket for England
big stride and an even bigger "ooh!" from the fielders. But no run
forward into position for the drive, but again, can't beat short cover
slightly misdirected, but nothing dramatic, just a calm clip to midwicket
forward again, but still can't beat the off-side ring. Very steady from Bopara

steady does the trick! That was the cumulative effect of an excellent spell from Bopara. Pitched right up to the bat, straight as they come, and Lokuarachchi misses with a leg-side nurdle. Rudi Koertzen's finger raises inexorably, and Sri Lanka are on the ropes
straight again
a fraction of width and cut, but not timed again
on the spot once again from Panesar. Sri Lanka need to bat out their 50 overs now
drawn forward and defended
no width to work with whatsoever
flight, loop, and bite. Great bowling
down on the sweep, but can't beat the man on the 45
dabbed into the covers for a single. Great constrictive over
great stuff again from Bopara, nothing more than straight and steady. No-one can get on top of him

a bit of width, and Cook makes a total hash of his slide on the point boundary. Overshoots the ball entirely, springs back in a vain attempt to cut it off, but the ball has nestled against the rope. A bit village that
back on that nagging line and length, and turned into the leg-side
misdirected this time, fired down the leg-side and Mustard takes with a juggle
back on the spot, Silva props forward and defends
drawn forward yet again, in position for the drive, but merely pushed out to point
tidy completion to the over, great job from Bopara
outside off stump, a measured drive to mid-off
a touch shorter, slapped hard to point but can't beat the field
drawn forward into the drive again, but Bell's quick hands at short cover snaffle the shot
big turn! That ripped out of the footholes and past a startled bat
outside off again, and treated with circumspection
tossed up to complete the over, glided to gully, and another tidy over to keep England in the ascendancy
edged! A wishy-washy drive took the outside edge past Mustard. Collingwood's wide at first slip and didn't stand a chance
that's very nicely bowled, angling this across the left hander who plays and misses
elegantly driven to point who parries it to Sidebottom, allowing them through to a single
with a high front elbow he drives to mid-off
absolutely no movement of the feet there. A flourishing drive out to extra cover
top shot - mind you, it was a rubbish ball. Short, wide and flayed past a diving Collingwood at point
solid start, landing this on off stump
cracked to Anderson's right at mid-off who dives and makes an excellent stop
cautiously forward on the front foot, he smothers it
confidently down the pitch with a skip and a shimmy before carving this out to the off side
this cramps Vaas for room who chops it down meekly out to the off side
pushed out to long-off
Bopara drops this short but Vaas can't get hold of it. His pull shot falls short of the bowler who picks it up and marches back to his mark
back cut wide of third man who jogs around to field
a leg-side stray which almost knocks the batsman off his feet as he tries to scoop it down the leg side
a quicker ball - Bopara really bent his Essex back, there - and Vaas nurdles it back to him with concrete feet
ooh he's gone for it. Vaas's eyes lit up like a rabbit in the headlights there; a short, wide tempter which he flayed over the infield
poor. Down the leg side and it's easily clipped to the vacant fine-leg boundary. Intelligent cricket (from the batsman...certainly not from Bopara)
well bowled! Too good for Vaas - a slower ball which Vaas played far too early and got a thick outside edge. It evaded Mustard's desperate grasp to his left, before wobbling down to third man
that's village. Down the leg side and rightly wided
sweetly struck past the outstretched hand of cover for an easy single
angled, or pushed, out into the cover
on his legs, it's clipped through midwicket
good thinking  -  a yorker, but misdirected down the leg side
straighter this time, but not quite of yorker length. Half a yorker, if you like. A yolker, perhaps
short of a length, he goes for a pull and gets a thin under-edge which falls short of Mustard

bowled him! A little too short to be cutting, and he never moved his feet either - they were absolutely concreted to the crease. Nevertheless, he went for the cut and inside-edged it onto his off stump
very wide which foxes the right hander who tries to cut...and misses by miles
a full toss, Fernando props forward and smites it through the covers for four
back-cut by the now confident Fernando past Collingwood (I think) at a short third man
short, wide and evaded
angled to point who initially fields it very well before stumbling, not unlike a reveller, and kicking it away
drops this out to cover
excellent bowling, swinging this into Fernando's legs. And he does well to dig it out, getting a thick inside edge into his boot
defended to leg
shot! That's a crunching blow from Silva who smacks this over the bowler's head. It was right in the slot and perfectly executed
fast, wide and he misses out here - flashing outside off
angled into the batsman who drops it down dead to the off side
well bowled! Brilliant ball from Broad. A firecracker outside off which bounced, seamed and left him at the last moment. Impressive
very neatly run down to third man
chopped down, with his axe, to third man
but he's gone this time, and that's clever cricket by England. A bouncer, Silva tries to uppercut it over third man's head but it loops straight down Anderson's throat
wide of the off stump and ignored
a swing-and-a-miss outside off
full and straight - a full toss in fact - which is defended
outside off, he tries to work it down to third man
firmly blocked out on the back foot
dropped out to midwicket
defended on the back foot
got him! Three wickets for Broad who sends down a superb slower ball, outfoxing Fernando who completely misread the dobber

inn2.comm: tucked into the leg-side
on the pads again and comfortably clipped into the leg-side again. First runs of the chase
on the pads again, and just falls short of short midwicket. Mustard not hanging around. Vaas is straining a touch for the outswinger
a fraction shorter, and easily worked off the hips
wicket-to-wicket. Slightly short but arrow-straight. Defended off the back foot
worked off the hip again, but straight to square leg. Slightly off-target first-up from Vaas, but the end result is a quiet over
fired onto the pads, a bit of a sighter and Mustard flicks fine
outside off stump, and pushed cautiously off the back foot, into the covers
a bit of lift outside off stump, Cook stands tall and steers out to point
back of a length this time, but still probing off stump. Pushed into the covers
nothing for Cook to work with. Pushed into the covers
very steady start for Malinga. On off stump again, and fended away with the minimum of aggression
still speared into the pads, but defended off the back foot. Vaas has lost his slip already
dabbed out to point
more width this time and a firm slash rebounds off point

edged and brilliantly caught outside off stump! A bit of width and Mustard had a slash, but Sangakkara read the situation perfectly, dived full-stretch with his right hand, and plucked the catch where first slip would have been! Massive breakthrough
a measured drive to start proceedings
tucked off the pads to complete the over
pushed into the covers, but no great venom
tucked into the gap
full and straight, defended off the back foot
tidy line again. Sri Lanka are making a fist of this defence
good line, good length, defended again
the end of a tidy over. Good line for Malinga
on the pads again, flicked into the leg side
no great movement from Vaas, but accurate enough. Straying onto the pads a fraction again and picked off
good line and length, Bell content to bide his time
pushed onto the back foot, and defended down the track
outside off stump, defended once again
pre-meditated shuffle from Bell - he does that a lot - and pushed out to the covers
width and walloped. That's a lovely strike from Cook, just waiting for the ball to get under his eyeline, and times it perfectly through backward point
arguably a better shot - in front of square this time, and less width to work with. But hauled in just inside the rope
into position for the drive, and pushed into the covers
that's a top-quality bit of batting. Malinga dragged that a fraction short, but Bell was onto it in a flash, standing tall on the back foot and drilled through the covers
might have been a wide if he'd let it go, but got enough bat on it to reach third man
outside off stump and left alone to complete the over
outside off stump, and steered into the covers
cramped for room on off stump, but worked into the leg-side
flicked off the pads for another single to backward square
outside off stump, and pushed off the back foot into the covers
good delivery, ducked back into the right-hander off the seam, but Bell was equal to it
steered off the back foot, into the hands of short cover
good length, outside off stump, pushed to mid-off
width, and movement too. Cook chases with leaden feet, but gets enough bat on it to beat a sprawling Jayawardene at wide slip. Not intended, but effective
fuller and straighter, and defended back up the pitch
outside off stump again, and left alone
tidy line and length. Excellent over so far
driven, but not timed. Short cover tidies up
naggingly accurate, defended on off stump with the keeper standing up
a fraction more width, but not a lot of timing
driven, and edged. That was a bit streaky, but passes the lone slip easily enough and third man tidies up
shorter length, but still plugging away at off stump. No risks from England yet
tucked off the hip to backward square
outside off stump again. Bell punches off the back foot but Vaas swoops to field, and that's the end of the over
width, but this time Cook misses out with his square-drivish steer. Point fields with a tumble
slower ball, low full toss, clipped out to deep square
fuller length and turned to square leg
low full-toss, Fernando is straining for the yorker, but Bell digs it out with a turn of the wrists
wide outside off stump and Bell climbs into a drive, but gets a fat inside edge and scoots the ball through square leg
slower ball, and Bell is suckered by it! Climbs into a flick over midwicket, but can't clear Malinga at mid-on! That's a very timely wicket, and once again Bell has fallen when well set
Cook is forward, defending
shot from Cook. Granted, it was on his legs, but he timed that brilliantly with nothing more than a flick of the wrists
pushed out to cover
full and straight, Cook comes forward and blocks it out
firmly defended - good line, this, from Vaas
good end to the over angling into the left-hander who defends, head over the ball
whipped to leg
drifting down the leg side, it brushes off Pietersen's pads to the leg side. A huge appeal from the bowler but it's not out
a full toss wide down the leg side. Massively wide
full, on his legs and Pietersen whips this to leg tor four. Perfect timing
on the stumps and propped forward
bouncer, and a very quick one too
good length outside off
more probing work from Vaas
clipped off the pads into space behind square
good line and length, and defended
nagging away outside off stump. Cook takes a big stride and pushes into the covers
defended off the back foot. No width on offer whatsoever
whipped off the pads again, and that's another over gone
good pace on off stump, Pietersen defends in a bit of a hurried jab
rising delivery, angled in from off stump, Pietersen pushes and sprints as midwicket comes in to field
a big stride again, but no way of beating the man at short cover
a gentle half-volley on the pads, and that's meat and drink to Cook. He plays coolly into the gap at midwicket and two more valuable runs
turned square, and fielded at midwicket
short and rising outside off, Cook shapes to cut but point intercepts
driven, but with no great power. Fielded at mid-on
another attempted drive, but through the shot too early
an outside edge, and that flies through the gap and all the way to the boundary. Lucky!
a massive appeal for a leg-side catch, but Pietersen is vastly unimpressed. Off the pad by the looks of it
a touch short of a length and it's pumped out to the off side without really timing it. Good length forcing him onto the back foot
good length and again he can only punch it back to the bowler
oh dear, a full toss. Double oh dear, poor fielding - two pieces of villageness there from Sri Lanka
slower ball from the bowler and Pietersen misreads it, pumping it back past the bowler mere inches from his outstretched right hand. But he's timed very well and it races down to long-on
pushed out to the off side by Cook
good catch! Another excellent take from Sangakkara diving to his left to pluck a thick outside edge from Cook, tumbling to his left. Not an easy catch by any means, but made to look very simple
spearing into Collingwood who punches it back to the bowler
punched through midwicket. A poor leg-side line there
on his legs, Collingwood turns it impishly off his hip and immediately calls Pietersen through for a single
remarkable flick for four. He was almost beaten in length before holding his pose, standing tall, to force this through midwicket and beat the valiant dive by the fielder on the rope
another edge! Pietersen flangs this without care, the ball flying through the vacant slips
and another! One foot forward and he slaps it over midwicket for another four
another whip, this time from outside off stump
carefully nudged to leg this time
outside the off stump, he guides this to cover
that's gone, I'm telling you. Collingwood is nailed back in his crease - absolutely no feet movement, and that's hitting middle-and-leg. Rudi Koertzen gives him the deathly slow finger of fate
Shah is back, across and defending
a bouncer which Shah evades, ducking beneath it
flicked off his pads for a single
guided out into the covers
pushed out into the covers
short of a length, Pietersen calmly defends it off the back foot
wide of the off stump but it's too full to be driving like a flamingo, which Pietersen does...and toe-ends it to nowhere
clever batting here. On the front foot, he comes forward before angling his bat behind square down to third man. Malinga hashes it on the boundary and they jog through for a stolen second
he's bowled him! Vaas has bowled him around his legs - what a wicket that is. Pietersen stepped across his stumps - why? - and Vaas zoned in to take out his leg stump
back and across, Bopara works this out to cover
well bowled - an off-cutter zipping back into Shah who is determinedly behind it
punched back to the bowler
late swing into Shah who carves it out to mid-off
flicked down to fine-leg
swinging in to Shah who again shows excellent timing in punching it to mid-off. Slightly dangerous stroke to play against the swinging ball

gone! And another one for Fernando who's found a beauty which spat up on Shah. He tried to fend it off but it ballooned straight to Lokuarachchi at cover. Another cracking delivery from Fernando who, it is fair to say, is absolutely on fire
flat and straight, Bopara smothers it on the front foot
fired in flat on the leg stump. Bopara nudges it for an easy single
Broad leans forward like a giant plucking berries, pushing this down to third man
solidly forward to defend this on the front foot
prodigious turn here but it's short enough to allow Bopara to cut
nudged around the corner
and there it is! Broad beaten by the slower ball and chips it straight into Jayasuriya's hands at midwicket
plays and misses outside off
and another! This is an extraordinary performance from Fernando. It was full, it was straight...and Sidebottom just missed it. Simple as that
pushed out behind square
guided out to cover
defended on the front foot, and defended solidly too
too short and the wrong line, spinning further down the leg side
again too short, too wide and Anderson plays this comfortably - a flick of the wrists and it scoots through midwicket
well bowled. Nicely tossed up on middle-and-leg, on a good length and it's smothered by the batsman
Bopara is back, cutting
confidently forward, it's defended by Anderson
nudged to leg for no run
a slower ball to start with. Bopara plays it well, and late
angled out into the covers
down the leg side and that's another wide
fine stroke from Bopara, clipping it confidently and crisply off his toes for a single
left alone outside off
another catch for Sangakkara and an easy one too. An indecisive poke from Anderson who tried to push it to cover and got a thick outside edge
Monty is right behind this, blocking it out like a legend
a massively turning leggie which beats the right hander
Bopara comes forward to smother
half a step down the pitch from Bopara who then clunks it to leg
very well bowled, and he receives applause and cries of "awww" from the clutch of close-in fielders
Monty defends like the No. 7 he probably isn't
Monty pads it away
a booming inswinger which is smeared through leg
Bopara solidly barn-doors this
a wide bouncer down the leg side
driven on the up over extra cover for four. A classy, lofted drive by a very gutsy young cricketer
on the leg side this time, nudged further for a single
a medium-sized appeal from the bowler who raps Monty on the pad, but it's outside leg
the most solid of forward defensives to end a mixed over
defended on the front foot
too straight. Monty ignores it and it spins down the leg side
beautifully driven with Graham Thorpe-esque class to cover
nudged out to cover
wristy flick to leg
Monty blocks it out
firmly defended
a booming inswinger at good pace, but Bopara's looking increasingly settled
nudged to leg
a slower ball. Bopara blocks
and Bopara takes a single. Monty only needs face one ball in the over
plays and misses outside off
nudged to leg
Monty carves this wider ball out to cover
dabbed out to extra cover
nibbled out to leg
short, wide and Bopara tries to cut but misses
yes they can as Bopara has found point
brilliant catch from Sangakkara to end the match as Monty fished to this wider ball. A thick outside edge and Sangakkara took a cracker to his left
